container-title: For their help and good suggestions, I thank the staff at the following libraries: the British Library, the National Archives at Kew, the National Library of Jamaica, the National Archive of Jamaica, the Archivo General de Indias in Seville, the Archivo General de la Nación in Mexico City
note: the Clements Library at the University of Michigan, and the libraries at Harvard University and the University of Kansas. Portions of this book benefited from comments and suggestions from participants at the Washington Area Early American History Seminar, the American Origins Seminar of the USC-​Huntington Early Modern Studies Institute, the workshop Empires in Context: England and Spain in the
title: This book would not have been possible without the support of many scholars and institutions. I especially thank John Demos, Joyce Chaplin, and Peter Mancall for guiding my thinking and encouraging my scholarship throughout the years. The research and writing for this book was supported by funding from the Charles Warren Center and the Artemas Ward Fellowship at Harvard University, the Hall Center for the Humanities at the University of Kansas, and the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences at the University of Kansas. Ted Widmer and the staff at the John Carter Brown Library created an excellent and supportive community in which the early research for this project was completed, during a Center for New World Comparative Studies Fellowship in 2009. Peter Mancall, Steve Hindle, and the staff at the University of Southern California-​Huntington Early Modern Studies Institute provided generous guidance and a stimulating intellectual environment for the last stages of research and writing during a Mellon Postdoctoral Fellowship

container-title: the New Maritime History conference at the Huntington Library, the McNeil Center for Early American Studies Graduate Student Conference, and the conferences of the Latin American Studies Association, the North American Conference on British Studies, and the American Historical Association
note: For their help through the years, I thank in particular Laurel Ulrich,
